name: Four Seasons Hotel Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: It looks like The Four Seasons, smells like The Four Seasons, has amazing service like the Four Seasons. But you won't sleep like you should at the Four Seasons. The walls are pretty thin. At rush hour, you can hear phones ring all over the floor as guests plan their their evenings. And at 4 AM? Let's just say, thank God the guy in 815 wasn't taking 36 hour Cialis. Someone told me the property was built to be another hotel chain. Unfortunately, the building itself has the quality of any other hotel chain. That being said, the staff couldn't be friendlier, the service couldn't be better, the food fantastic. Who needs sleep? We'll get enough when we're dead.
reviews.title: 3.2 Seasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why stay at the Four Seasons Buenos Aires? Service. In a word - impeccable.
reviews.title: Service sets this Four Seasons apart from the rest of BA hotels

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I frequently stay in Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons and many other 5 star hotels - over 100 nights per year. The staff of this particular Four Seasons are superb. Professional, genuine and very intuitive service delivered by well trained professionals.
reviews.title: The Fifth Dimension

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had an executive suite facing the La Mansion. I would strongly recommend booking rooms or suites facing the backside "La Mansion". This is by far a more pleasant view than the highway/freeway view which is at the front of the hotel.
reviews.title: Four Seasons one Pleasure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Four Seasons is on the edge of the fashionable Recoleta neighborhood. It is in a busy and rather "un-pretty" area of Recoleta with a major trafficway running by the side. However our room was very quiet.
reviews.title: True Argentine Luxury Mansion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel in an Executive Suite in May 2011. Fantastic room, fantastic service, and great atmosphere that wasn't too stuffy. We have stayed at a number of Four Seasons, and this one is our favorite to date. You get the excellent service you expect from a Four Seasons, with the charm and atmosphere that is uniquely Buenos Aires. Everything the concierge recommended was excellent - from tango shows, to where to buy clothes when airline lost ours. Don't hesitate to stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exceptional views of The Rio de la Plata, nearby The Patio Bullrich for an excellent shopping!
reviews.title: Mi visit to Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great hotel. Excellent service. Very convenient location, close to downtown but not extremely far from areas like Palermo.
reviews.title: Great choice. If you go for business, stay at the Executive Floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food, both at the restaurants and for room service is just awesome.
reviews.title: Great service & location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you go for business reasons, stay at the Executive Floor. They have a nice living room with a very handy nespresso machine, tea and cold beverages are also available.
reviews.title: 4 Seasons, Better value elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed stayed twice in this Four Seasons (at the beginning and end of a holiday around Argentina).
reviews.title: Good, but not as good as we expect from a Four Seasons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The good points - the service is good. The food is good - particularly the breakfast buffet. The location is good. The bed is comfortable and the room was spacious.
reviews.title: easily one of the best run hotels in the world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The disappointing points. Rooms feel rather dated - lacked any wow factor that you usually expect from a Four Seasons. The charges for using wireless internet are astronomical. $20 US per day PER DEVICE - felt that this was a complete rip off. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room.
reviews.title: Why stay anywhere else?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: we had the pleasure of staying here for 3 nights in row and then one night before our flight home. the staff is exemplary. nothing is too hard for them to take care of. so polite that it literally left my husband and i speechless. we have stayed at some of the finest hotels in the world and this one is up there with the best. the rooms are large, well appointed. the gym and spa are wonderful. breakfast in restuarant not to be missed. the bar is sublimely elegant. we flew to el calafate and needed to store some extra luggage, on our return to the hotel our bags where in our rooms waiting for us.
reviews.title: Service at its best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Four Seasons was a phenomenal choice for us. It was very comfortable as far as the staff, the accomodations and the entire approach. It was not overly stuffy which some high end hotels can be, which was wonderful. We developed a great rapport with the front desk staff as well as the restaurant and pool staff. From the first contact onward, it felt like "home". Breakfast was unbelievable, so make sure you either book with the buffet breakfast or you take advantage of it everyday. It sets the "culture" for your experience in Argentina.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a wonderful city.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not the prettiest of the big hotels in BA. Hyatt/Alvear definitely aesthetically beautiful. But, Four Seasons staff were highly prudent to warning us about walking around BA - not wearing anything flashy. The tour guide they hired for us was also the best guide in any city that I have had - was worth every penny and you get a car for the day to drive you around to show you the key districts. Rooms were nice and comfortable. This was not a special expericence, but very relicable one if you need somewhere to stay as you get your bearings in this big city. Pool area is really nice.
reviews.title: Good place to plant roots as your find bearings in BA

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: The hotel keeps up to it's brand. Perfect service, gourmet food, good rooms. Located in quite spot of Retiro district-very convinient as it's in the walking distance from Av.9 de Julio and close to the airport, so that you will not be stuck in the traffic jam (which are quite common there). You can also get anywhere around the city using taxis-bell boy will get you one and take down the number plate-just to make sure you are safe. Do visit La Boca and Ricoleta districts-its a must! And spend one if the evenings at Puerta Madera-full of fancy restaurants, bars and clubs.
reviews.title: True luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has an outdoor swimming pool and a spa.the pool area is quite small,so on the hot day it is very crowded, but anyway still well-managed: fast waiters, free use if sun creams, etc. Massages at the spa were ok, nothing impressive, but they did their job ok.
reviews.title: Excellent - except for room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We booked a New Years eve dinner at the hotel and never regreted it: 7-course gourmet dinner, live music, disco-everything was perfect!
reviews.title: One of the better Four Seasons I've stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Highly recommended! True luxury!
reviews.title: Well Run, Comfortably and Welcoming Hotel

description: Sophisticated High-rise Hotel incorporating an elegant turn-of-the-century French Mansion.
